Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2013 10:02AM kfontaine wrote: Angelm- I am sorry! Sorry you are here...sorry what you have been through! Just like you, please get me through my childrens young years for their sake...and then I will take it as it comes! Marsh--sorry that you find yourself back here! Here is to hoping that Tamoxifen works for you! Debbie- Thanks...got my results back today.... i have thalmic (spelling) hyperplasia...my thalamus is 4cm/...not sure what that means, but I hope it is not a biopsy! I have read different things about it, something called a rebound thalmus?? Not sure, will let you know more once I speak to onc. Thanks- hugs and prayers to all, Kristen
Posts.Title: Roll Call 2013 LilSchatzie reader123

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2013 12:08PM kfontaine wrote: It is amazing...all over the world! Speaking of, I have a chance to travel to Holland with half expenses paid, but my boss denied my leave--well, because i do not have any and it will be leave without pay---all my leave has been used up from all the appts, chemo, surgery, etc.. I guess I am only allowed to be off if I am sick! :( So, now very disappointed as I probably will not get that chance again... My husband and I agreed that we can do without one paycheck, if it means getting to go to Holland together! I was in tears when my boss told me...but there is nothing I can do about it! Kristen
Posts.Title: Roll Call 2013 LilSchatzie reader123

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2013 12:21PM kfontaine wrote: Hello! I am 34-soon to turn 35 Nice to meet everyone! Just a little history....I have been married to my hubby for almost 15 years, we have 2 amazing little girls...6 and 9. They are my world! January 5th of 2012 I felt a big lump on the top of my breast, pretty much on my chest (it was high up), and went to doctors...well long story short...grade 3+++ HER/PR/ER  actually 2 tumors, approximately 4 cm was the larger! What a shock that was! No family history, just had my female exam with breast exam 3 months earlier! So I was scheduled for Double Mastectomy 2/10/12, and on 2/8/12 I had a CT of my whole body, because i had been complaining of back pain! So they found a spot on my liver, 1.2 cm. Surgery was canceled and chemo started, TCH for 6 rounds. Had my last scan of my liver in Dec and they do not see anything! THANK YOU LORD!! Have another scan tonight, and it is almost 1 year to the day since that aweful scan! SO NERVOUS! My husband tries to stay positive, but he knows.... he came home and asked me about buying more life insurance! that conversation did not go over well! Love you all, Kristen
Posts.Title: Roll Call 2013 LilSchatzie reader123

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2012 11:37AM kfontaine wrote: Well, had 6 rounds of TCH and then BMX. Now going to have liver resection, 20% of liver removed. Any other stories of radiation or surgery to liver?
Posts.Title: Long term with liver mets? mkkjd60 soleil505

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2012 07:37AM - edited Oct 3, 2012 07:43AM by kfontaine Well, scans last Thursday, liver lesion back....1.1cm. It went from not visible in June to 1.1 cm now. WOWSA! Anywho, had to chuckle when surgeon try to convince me to do another biopsy because it may be scar tissue.....really??? I guess i looked like a complete idiot to him....I would love to be positive, but how about realism right now. It is in the same exact place it was before chemo..... Wish i could have just had my surgery on 12 Sep. Now....where do i go from here??? I want surgery-no one will do it except for one surgeon who is a million miles away....cyberknife is a possibility if I can get into the rad onc clinic...
Posts.Title: Long term with liver mets? mkkjd60 soleil505

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2012 10:57AM kfontaine wrote: Okay, got a call from surgeon who gave me my CT Results. He said he had two other radiologists compare it to my last CT and there is nothing there to be worried about.....WHAT??? I started crying and shaking all over...still cannot wrap my brain around the fact that they are saying nothing is there....the fear did not go away.  I had her talk to the doc again and call me back to make sure I was the right patient. He just told me 2 days ago that he saw it back in my liver again. Anywho....I am getting the disc this weekend for the Radiologists here to look at...WOW. What a wild ride of emotions. I am not complaining, but wow..... Thanks for listening to me vent.
Posts.Title: Long term with liver mets? mkkjd60 soleil505

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2012 10:16AM kfontaine wrote: Thanks Soleil....I believe he is in a war zone somewhere.....so impossible. I wish they would just send him back. This stinks. I told the nurse navigator everything about CT Scans, so she is relaying all info to my Onc and my surgeon who did MX. So, now the waiting game....AGAIN.
Posts.Title: Long term with liver mets? mkkjd60 soleil505

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2012 10:58AM - edited Oct 30, 2012 11:00AM by kfontaine I will tell you my story....in Feb 12 dx with IDC Stage IV Mets to Liver. At the same time I was having severe back pain and xray showed nothing, but I was absolutely convinced something was there i was in so much pain! My onc ordered an MRI....and NOTHING! But i would have bet 1 million dollars something was there....but nothing. So, what I am saying, is you never know, you just never know! Then after that...my back did not bother me again. I recently just had a bone scan for some other pain, but do not have any results yet!

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2012 11:49AM kfontaine wrote: Stagefree-  I am pretty much following the same diet, except green tea...did not know about that one... but I will switch to chamomile tea from now on. I did not see chicken on the list...I have been eating the chicken- veggie fed, no hormones added, all natural chicken maybe once a week.  The Alkalinity water, i am drinking between 7.5-8.0 right now, since I just got the machine, taking it slow.  How high were you advised to go on that??? Oh and grapefruits, been eating about one per week....cutting those out, since  I have liver METS. Thanks,

They said PET scan will show cancer all over my body. Am i going to die? I have a 5 and 8 year old little girls and a great husband. I am not ready to die. Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2012 05:01PM kfontaine wrote: Shirlann, Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! For making me feel normal. I know my husband thinks I am crazy and I think my friends are thinking it too!  Yes, right now i think cancer has completely taken over my whole body! Thank you for the laugh too! I needed that right now. My doc did give me valium, but i am scared to take it, like it is going to spread cancer to the crevices that do not have cancer in it already...i know my mind is going crazy!!  Thank you for the hugs, you are great! Kristen

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2012 05:00PM kfontaine wrote: I am sorry to hear about your sister, but I am also 34 years old, two girls 6& 9. I was dx in January with MBC to liver. One great thing that one of my friends did for our family was do the Meal Train, the website where friends and family can organize dinners for the family. That was a huge help during chemo, not having to worry about making dinner every night was so nice. Prayers going your family's way!

Is there anything special i should be doing as far as household 'stuff' goes? Any tips before surgery, I am having a double mastectomy with immediate reconstruction---which not totally sure about details, i meet the plastic surgeon on Tuesday, 31 January.
